title: Federica Del Buono
text:
Federica Del Buono (born 12 December 1994) is an Italian <a href="middle-distance%20runner">middle-distance runner</a> who competes mainly in <a href="track%20and%20field">track events</a>. She was the bronze medallist in the <a href="1500%20metres">1500 metres</a> at the <a href="European%20Athletics%20Indoor%20Championships">European Athletics Indoor Championships</a> in 2015. She has a personal best of 4:05.32 minutes for the event. She won the 2014 Italian national title and represented Italy at the <a href="2014%20European%20Athletics%20Championships">2014 European Athletics Championships</a>. She competed at the <a href="2020%20Summer%20Olympics">2020 Summer Olympics</a>, in the <a href="Athletics%20at%20the%202020%20Summer%20Olympics%20%E2%80%93%20Women%27s%201500%20metres">1500 m</a>.
Her parents <a href="Gianni%20Del%20Buono">Gianni Del Buono</a> and <a href="Rossella%20Gramola">Rossella Gramola</a> were also two middle-distance runners.
Career.
Born in <a href="Vicenza">Vicenza</a>, Del Buono began training with <a href="Rossella%20Gramola">her mother</a> as coach and became a member of the <a href="Gruppo%20Sportivo%20Forestale">Gruppo Sportivo Forestale</a> sports club. Early in her life, she was more interested in <a href="dance">dance</a>, but began taking part in <a href="athletics%20%28sport%29">athletics</a> in seriousness around 2011. She soon rose to prominence nationally and competed in the heats of the <a href="1500%20metres">1500 metres</a> at the <a href="2012%20World%20Junior%20Championships%20in%20Athletics">2012 World Junior Championships in Athletics</a>. Del Buono also ran over 4 km at the <a href="2012%20European%20Cross%20Country%20Championships">2012 European Cross Country Championships</a>, finishing 40th overall.
She won her first international medal at the inaugural 1500 m at the <a href="2014%20Mediterranean%20Athletics%20U23%20Championships">2014 Mediterranean Athletics U23 Championships</a>, beating Olympic medallist <a href="Gamze%20Bulut">Gamze Bulut</a> to the gold medal. A fourth place in senior competition followed at the <a href="2014%20European%20Team%20Championships%20Super%20League">2014 European Team Championships Super League</a>. She went on to be selected for the 1500 m at the <a href="2014%20European%20Athletics%20Championships">2014 European Athletics Championships</a>, where she placed fifth in a personal best of 4:07.49 minutes. She won her first national title in the 1500 m at that year's <a href="Italian%20Athletics%20Championships">Italian Athletics Championships</a>.
The twenty-year-old Del Buono won her first senior medal at the <a href="2015%20European%20Athletics%20Indoor%20Championships">2015 European Athletics Indoor Championships</a>. Competing over her specialty 1500 m, she took a clear third place for the bronze medal with a run of 4:11.61 minutes.
